data.title: Cozy italian place
data.text: A small place located in a strip mall, but don't get fooled by the location. The atmosphere and decorations are great,  and the food is fantastic!

data.title: Nice atmosphere, Good Service, Average Food
data.text:
Disclaimer - After spending over a week in Italy on our honeymoon, my wife and I agree Italian food in the US is typically disappointing in comparison.

My wife and I ate here the other day for dinner. I had spaghetti and meatballs and she had the sausage baci al forno. We both thought the food was okay, but not great. My wife's dish was supposed to be "spicy" but she said it wasn't at all. She does like very spicy food though so maybe her idea of spicy wasn't the same. My dish was okay as well, but nothing great. The meatballs were good and helped me like the dish more, but overall it was just lacking a lot of flavor for me. The sauce was bland and didn't have much more than a small hint of garlic. The prices were average too and with each of us getting an alcoholic drink our total bill was around $40. I wouldn't discourage anyone from a visit, but I don't think we'll be going back.

data.title: Great food poor service
data.text: We were 4 friends.  Seated promptly in a back corner. The food was terrific and plentiful.  I had eggplant parm., my husband had spaghetti and meatballs.  Our waitress Alex (female) was not very attentive. Forgot to bring dressings for our salads.  Did not refill our water glasses. I requested an extra napkin, never got it.  Our friends remarked how she got friendly at bill time.  On the other hand, Emily, another waitress took time from her patrons to get us our dressings. So, thank you Emily. We observed her care,of,her patrons. She did a nice job.  Not sure if we will return. Our men did not like that Alex just disappeared and did not check on us.

data.title: Top notch Italian
data.text: We ate here with another family, kids and adults enjoyed their food. Chicken Marsala best I've ever had! Service was excellent. We'll be back next time we're in the area.

data.title: Anniversary dinner
data.text: Service was very good. Waitress was friendly, and very knowledgeable of the menu, and specials. Food was good. It was very noisy, and could not hear the waitress, or ourselves talk. This was our 30th anniversary, and we were from Ohio, visiting family. Thought it would be nice to have dinner in an authentic Italian restaurant. But kind a disappointed in the loud atmosphere.

data.title: Saturday night flop
data.text:
Wow. All these good reviews lead me to believe we just hit a bad night. 
Came in and were pleased that they did their best to get us seated in about 15 minutes. VERY crowded and noisy... Why do people scream at people sitting 3 feet away? I'll never understand. Lol. 
Party ordered wine - I ordered espresso which was really poorly made and tasted awful. On to dinner - I ordered chicken Saltimboca from the "House Specialties" list. It came as two "roll ups" which were both cut into- assumption was to check if they were fully cooked- and they were... Wait for it... DEEP FRIED. All pieces were dry and crispy and in a word - inedible. Served with a mound of completely dry fettuccine as a "side", and some unseasoned veggies. Place was so busy and hectic I did not dare send it back...
Seems like when staff sees a relatively untouched dinner, it may dawn on them to ask if there was an issue... Not today. 
No one else's dinner looked enviable either. Also not sure if they were short of dinnerware or were rushing us but we were asked about packing up leftovers and taking plates away 3 times. Overall just a total disappointment.

data.title: Great family run restaurant
data.text: Visited with work colleagues.  Great Italian cuisine, attentive, friendly staff.  Check out the specials board for some great dishes.  On my list of must visits when I'm over from the UK.

data.title: Wonderful!
data.text: Wonderful meal on a cold night! The pasta was amazing and the staff was great - even making a cocktail for a friend that was not on the menu. The appetizers were great and I can't wait to get back again.

data.title: Great Golf Show Finish Dinner
data.text: Several of my friends, while attending the Michigan Golf Show went to Maisano's and it's a small place in a little strip mall area, but really wonderful food.  We had chicken Parm, Lasagna, Chicken Marinaro and caeser Salad.  Wine selection is huge and you can't go wrong eating here!

data.title: Great family neighborhood restaurant
data.text: Great family restaurant. Entree are $11-$15 each. A little noisy for a quiet couple dinner but fine for kids. Lots of families their. Very friendly atmosphere. Service a bit slow on a busy Saturday night but food is good. Soups are excellent clearly homemade. Sauce is good. Lasagna is a winner. Homemade fresh blue berry bread is a winner with kids. Owner is out an about making sure customers are happy. A real Novi neighborhood gem!!!

data.title: Good Italian Food
data.text: Went here for my daughter's birthday.  We had a new waitress, so a few things went wrong. They have a very good menu of Italian Food.  My husband got a steak and it was just so so.  Stick with the typical Italian food here.  Was very busy so make an reservation.  Prices were very good, so I would try again.

data.title: Great little Italian place
data.text: I dined solo at Maisano's while traveling to the area for business.  The service was a bit slow at first - I had to wait a bit to be seated and when I stated I was dining alone, the hostess seemed a bit confused and had to ask where one person could be seated.  Once seated, it took longer than I anticipated to have my order taken.  However, once the waitress came to my table, she was very friendly and helpful, answering a couple questions I had on the menu.  I ordered the lasagne, which was delicious.  Paired with a glass of the house cabernet, it was a delicious meal.  I look forward to visiting again.

data.title: Another delicious meal!
data.text: We went for dinner this past Saturday night, with no reservation, and had to wait about 25 minutes. It was worth it! Three in our group had the famous chicken Marsala, and I had the chicken picante (similar to piccata). Both were absolutely delicious, with large portions. We shared a bottle of Chianti off the wine list- also fabulous. We will certainly return, again and again.

data.title: Don't be deceived by the reviews
data.text: I have been visiting this restaurant for over 20 years and have always had consistently great food.  Even after the owners changed, the food has been terrific.  The service is inconsistent but generally good to great.  We visited with a party of 6 last night, had reservations and were expecting a great experience.  But this was my first experience dealing with the "manager".  I don't know if he is the manager or the owner, but I do know that he does not care about his customers.  The evening started well with a delightful waitress and a wonderful bottle of wine.  We ordered quickly and the food came out a little slow, but we didn't care.  The place was packed and it would be easy to fall a little behind.  A few minutes after our dinner came out, they started rushing us to get our food boxed.  We were still eating.  After being asked a few times we decided to box our food and save room for dessert.  Their dessert is amazing.  Only instead of offering us dessert we received the check.  We asked why we were being rushed out and were told the manager wanted to seat a party of 7 that had been waiting.  It was very frustrating to see a young waitress doing great and the manager giving advice that was not customer friendly at all.  When we approached the manager to complain he was completely rude to us.  After 20 years and many good meals, I'm not sure I will ever go back.  There are too many good restaurants to choose from to take the risk of being treated so poorly.

data.title: Great find - location is deceiving!
data.text:
My husband and I almost didn't go in when we found it in a strip mall...next to an "adult" store. After reading great reviews while sitting in the parking lot, though, we decided to try it out. It was exactly what we were looking for - dressy but not stuffy, delicious without being expensive. We were there on a weeknight and only 2 other tables were taken. Waitress was very friendly and knowledgable of the food. Note: some search engines show this restaurant is closed permanently - not true! They had fired someone and then suddenly the web was saying they were closed. At the time the owners were trying to figure out how to correct that. 
Stop in for dinner; you won't regret it!

data.title: Best service I've had in a long time.
data.text: After many years of telling friends I wouldn't go to a restaurant on New Year's Eve as it is not a night I normally expect excellent service.   Our waitress, Jamie, changed that.  She was friendly, bright, on top of things and great.   Even when there was a bit of a wait, she kept returning to the table.   The food was very good (as it usually is) although Chicken Piccata had a few pieces that were tough to chew.

data.title: Eh! disappointed
data.text: I'd give tonight a C, which is sad because we used to frequent this restaurant often, a few years ago. This New Year's Eve we decided to go back again as we couldn’t remember why we stopped going there. We would have gone to East side Mario’s in Livonia, but wanted to be closer to home, and decided against Caraberra's as we wanted a smaller, quieter environment. Maisano's is small, has beautiful decor and candlelight, plus they take reservations, which is what I was wanting this night!  Before we went, hubby said, you'd better check the menu it’s been a while, who knows maybe the steaks are $39 now. So I checked the menu online and gladly reported that the Filet was $20. I drooled over the menu trying to select my dish, and everything sounded just so wonderful. Our reservation was for 4:30, and the place quickly filled up. Looking around it was just as gorgeous as I remembered the waitress lit the candle and then we looked at the menu, surprised to find that the online menu was not the same. There were dishes no longer offered, and Lord behold the filet steak was actually $31!!! The waitress was sweet, and soft spoken and sporting a large red-faced devil on her neck and black lipstick. It took a VERY very long time to get the bread, and unfortunately for us we went hungry.  Food delivery took a very long time, and arrived not hot.  Hubby said the chicken parm was so tender you could cut it with a fork, but the lasagna was not that great (compared to Mario’s). My veal Marsala was cold but tasty. Though the prices were competitive this is not the place where you get alot of food and go home with left over’s, or maybe that was because we were soooo hungry by the time our food finally arrived that we ate more than usual?  I really think the servings were sparse.  Some good points they were attentive to refilling our Iced Tea, there seemed to be alot of regulars, my food was tasty although cold, and most prices were reasonable (aside from the steak). I did mention to the waitress we were surprised that the online menu was so different, she said that when the owners split one locked the other out of the website and they couldn’t update the changes, and yes the price on the steak did go up (by $11!!!!) I said well, we reviewed the menu and prices before we came out and were very unhappy to see we prepared our wallet and heads with wrong selections and price expectations. Honestly if it weren’t New Years Eve and we weren’t so hungry I would have left without ordering. Well, now we know why we stopped going, we now recall the very very loooonnggg wait for our food. You would think the owner would make an effort to correct the online menu, and make sure the food gets out quickly once it is ready...but alas, maybe this review will wake him up. And about the waitresses tattoo, I know this is America and she can alter her body whichever way she wishes, but honestly a demons red face on her neck like that? She should have worn her hair down, or covered it with makeup. Yeah, in all honestly it did affect her tip, just saying, it should have been a classier evening with this prices.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Amazing food, you walk in the door and you smell the goodness.    That itself says a ton!  I am not a huge cannoli fan...but I went for it based on where I was...best I have ever had.  Service was spectacular. What a great family business!  Support the locals.

data.title: Viva Italiano!
data.text: A hidden gem in Novi! The staff is amazing and attentive. You are always greeted like you're family when you go. Depending on the day/time, reservations are recommended. Attire can run from shorts/jeans to dresses/suits. The food is delicious - each dish prepared and presented by an top chef. You can't go wrong with any entree and there are specials every night. From 2 guests to a party of 10+, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Great little find!
data.text: We found this on Trip Advisor and thought we'd try it out. Wow, we are so happy we did. We went with a total of 8 people and all of us loved it. The staff was very friendly and helpful with menu suggestions. The portions were awesome, especially with four hungry men. We would gladly recommend this restaurant to anyone coming to Novi.
